images.copyright: Birch trees in autumn, Drammen, Norway (© Baac3nes/Getty Images)
images.title: Shades of autumn
images.caption: Birch trees, Drammen, Norway
images.desc: Surrounded by forests and embraced by fjords, the Norwegian port city of Drammen is a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Birch trees flourish at high altitudes, making them a natural fit for the mountainous region. When autumn arrives, their leaves transform into a mosaic of gold and crimson, in stark contrast to their pale, slender trunks. Long associated with new beginnings and renewal, birch trees don't just look good, they provide a home and sustenance for wildlife, and can be used for firewood and in construction.
